item.title: Misc tools
item.description: Tools to help understand grammer sUtras (3V, T, D, A, Ar). Also see apps linked under dictionaries. General aShTAdhyAyI simulation (aruNa, ) pratyAhAra-tools [D, V]. Domain specific languages tailored for the saMskR^ita grammar are beginning to be seen (V).

item.title: Parsing and Translation
item.description: Mechanically parsing (kmadathil, H) Sanskrit text, doing part of speech tagging(D). Producing, standardizing Sanskrit corpora (Ms..). Some tagged Sanskrit data (UFAL) Translating Sanskrit into a more familiar language. (F=H, 2H, BuSt) kramapATha-generator (B). Help beginning Sanskrit readers by marking up roots and vibhakti-s (F).

item.title: Word from root
item.description: prAtipadika declension Produce declensions while showing sUtra-s (D). Inflected word generation is usually based on the ‘word and paradigm’ model, close to the work such as ruupa chandrikaa which gives the naamaruupaavalii for ‘typical’ words ending in different var.nas in different lingas. (D, I=H1, H, H2, F, B) Apps (ViPra) Limitation: However, as a generative model the above is not perfect because, not being based firmly on pANini's rules (which separate saMskR^ita from apabhraMShA), they may generate wrong inflections.
